CatDescriptText: Mr. Al Casella, laundry driver, North Side and Mrs. Elizabeth Martino, hotel employee, Mt. Washington, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1962, pg. 13 with question: "Do you think the Kennedy Administration is anti-big business?"  Mr. Casella's answer reads: "No.  They are playing politics.  In a short time, everything will be back to where it was before and big business will have the prices they wanted."  Mrs. Martino's answer reads: "I think that the country was in bad shape until Kennedy acted.  he knows what he wants and he's looking out for the welfare of all the people."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Al Casella wearing light colored button down shirt, standing in front of Mellon Bank, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Elizabeth Martino wearing circle patterned dress and dark coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
